entry.title: How do I know when the publishing of an article happened ?
entry.content: After initial site configuration, as well as every time an article gets published, you will receive an Email by the Cloudburo Publishing Bot.

entry.title: Which Evernote Notebooks are created by the Publishing Bot ?
entry.content:
The Cloudburo Publishing Bot requires for the communication with Evernote a set of Evernote Notebooks per configured site. Additionally the Publishing Bot will create a set of tags which allows you to control the site publishing process.

These notebooks - as well as the tags - will be created during the initial site configuration steps. Additionally the publishing bot will check before each process run, the availability of the Notebooks and Tags in your Evernote Account and would kick off a recreation, in case you deleted or removed notebooks or tags accidentally.

Notebooks created by the Publishing Bot


The Publishing Bot will create for each site - in this example you would have chosen the name blogtest during site configuration - 5 new Evernote Notebooks. They start with the the prefix blog-

  • A-Fetch: Is a notebook required by the News Publishing Workflow. Any article place here will be full text extracted and moved to the B-Prepare notebook by the Publishing Bot. For details refer to the following How To.
  • B-Prepare: Is used by News Publishing Workflow, as well as can be seen as the notebook where you store your draft articles you are working on (this is optional, obviously you can work on a note in any kind of notebook). The Publishing bot isn’t doing anything with this notebook.
  • D-NewsGen: Move your ready-to-publish notes which are following the News Workflow to this Notebook. For details refer to the following How To. The Publishing Bot will fetch periodically the articles and publishes them, you will be informed by email when the publishing completed.
  • E-CurateGen: Move your ready-to-publish notes which are self-created or curation to this Notebook. For details refer to the following How To. The Publishing Bot will fetch periodically the articles and publishes them, you will be informed by email when the publishing completed.
  • Z-Archive: All published notes will be moved to this note book. In case you want to update some notes. Go here, update the content and move it back to the D-NewsGen or E-CurateGen notebook, dependent on the article style.
Tags created by the Publishing Bot


The Publishing Bot will create a set of Tags required for its working, they all start with the prefix clb-

  • clb-footer<#>, clb-menu<#> allows you to control the Menu- and Footer area of your site. Refer to the following How To.
  • clb-index is used to identify a page, which used as your customised index page. Refer to the following How To.
  • clb-image-* allows you to control how pictures are rendered in your site. Refer to the following How To.
  • clb-processed will be allocated to each Evernote note, which got published on a site.

Tags created by You

You can create any tags starting with your site name <sitename>-. When associated with a notes, they will be converted in a blog category, refer to the following How To.

entry.title: Customizable Site Header and Footer Menus
entry.content:
You can customize the Header and Footer Menu of a site.

By default, the index page will show the published articles, complemented by a Header Menu “Categories” and “By Year”.


You have now the possibility to define 4 additional Header, as well as 4 additional Footer menus. In the following example there are two additional menus defined: “About” and “Contact”.


The additional menus are defined via the site configuration in the Memberzone Dashboard area (Setup Tab). Select the relevant site configuration.


Scroll down to Main Menu and Footer Menu area. And change the name from Empty (i.e. no menu entry is shown) to your menu name. In the example below, we have chosen to add to Main Menu entries called “ About” and “Contact“


The Publishing Bot, will create in its next run, two main menus (see the screenshot) on the published site, as well as create corresponding pages and tags ( clb-menu1, clb-menu2) in your Evernote account.


You now can customize the pages, to your need. In the example below, the About page is shown (with its associated tag clb-menu1). Move it to your notebook *-E-CurateGen in order to get it generated.

entry.title: Showcase: Full Product Documentation Website managed by the Evernote Publishing Bot
entry.content:
This is a special showcase due to the fact that this site which you are looking at is actually the showcase itself.

I.e. the full documentation site of the publishing bot, enriched with images, videos and detailed content is edited in Evernote and published via the publishing bot.

Actually, we are following the principle ‘eat your own dogfood’ within Cloudburo, i.e. we are using our own product for content publishing. This allows us to constantly fine-tune the offering and improve its usability and efficiency.

Stroll around on our site and check out some pages to get a feeling how a full-fledged site could look like. Best is to start on the home page, which gives you a detailed overview.

More Cloudburo Publishing Bot Showcases.

This blog entry was fully produced within Evernote and published using the Cloudburo Publishing Bot.

entry.title: How to buy a subscription product
entry.content:
Login to or Sign up to the memberzone and follow the steps shown in the video tutorial.

Our credit card handling is done via Stripe, which is PCI Level 1 certified (highest security standard). You can find out more details how we manage credit card payments in the following article.


More How To’s Articles

This blog entry was fully produced within Evernote and published using the Cloudburo Publishing Bot.
